title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 September 2014 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> hmm ci.xwiki.org is not anwering...  
00:51 <vmassol> Enygma`: done on my side, pretty happy to have closed http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11050 today. Good luck with the end of the release. You shouldn't be far now :)

13:48 <vmassol> guys, don't forget that we still need to fix the build :)  
13:48 <vmassol> sending a proposal for the 6.3 roadmap in a few minutes  
13:49 <vmassol> 9 jobs failing ATM  
14:07 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <vmassol> mail sent for 6.3 roadmap  
14:10 <vmassol> please make sure to merge on the 6.2.x branch important bug fixes  
14:16 <vmassol> Denis: do you know why this is so: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11072 ?  
14:17 <vmassol> I checked XWiki/ResetPasswordMailContent  
14:17 <vmassol> and it only has an edit deny for allgroup + unreg users  
14:17 <vmassol> so I don't understand why view wouldn't be allowed  
14:18 <Denis> if not explicitly given, how do you expect it to be allowed ?  
14:18 <vmassol> because normally when there's nothing it's allowed  
14:19 <Denis> but Ludo says he explicitly close the wiki to XWikiGuest, isn't it ?  
14:19 <vmassol> hmmm  
14:19 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:20 <vmassol> Denis: actually I had the issue locally with the default E  
14:20 <Denis> I think he wanted to have access to reset password when not logged in, even on a closed wiki  
14:20 <vmassol> XE  
14:20 <vmassol> I'm rebuilding now  
14:21 <vmassol> ok maybe it means we need to force setting the view right for this page at page level right  
14:21 <vmassol> checking first the default with a clean XE  
14:22 <Denis> xwikibot: you're stupid !  
14:22 <vmassol> actually xwiki is stupid :)  
14:22 <vmassol> not allowing concurrent write to a page….  
14:22 <Denis> No, XWiki is awesome !  
14:22 <vmassol> :)  
14:23 <vmassol> IRC could handle retries, we might want to handle that at the storage level though….  
14:23 <cjd> solution: silence the message then xwikibot can quietly be stupid and xwiki's awesomeness will not be questioned  
14:23 <vmassol> :)  
14:24 <Denis> that was the phrase I recently use for a support case to WebEx that mixup keyboard layout and write XZiki is qzeso$e !  
14:24 <cjd> that said: I have better luck doing the opposite, something's going wrong and I don't know what.. throw a little Assertion in there and it'll start crashing and I'll get depressed enough to fix it  
14:25 <Denis> do not get why you have concurrent write ?  
14:25 <vmassol> because each line typed in IRC generates a write AFAIR  
14:26 <vmassol> so if you type quickly you get problems  
14:26 <vmassol> a  
14:26 <vmassol> a  
14:26 <vmassol> a  
14:26 <vmassol> a  
14:26 <vmassol> a  
14:26 <vmassol> a  
14:26 <vmassol> a  
14:26 <vmassol> hmm worked :)  
14:26 <cjd> 14:26 < vmassol> a  
14:26 <cjd> 14:26 < vmassol> a  
14:26 <cjd> 14:26 < vmassol> a  
14:26 <cjd> 14:26 < vmassol> a  
14:26 <vmassol> yup paste is better  
14:26 <cjd> typical irc clients buffer messages so the irc server won't kill them  
14:26 <vmassol> faster  
14:27 <cjd> I disabled that so I'm at risk for an (Excess Flood)  kill when I paste  
14:28 <vmassol> we could throttle the writes in the IRC bot app for sure, combining several messages in one write, by leaving some buffer… Had been wanting to fix it but time flies...  
14:29 <cjd> PircBot does it internally  
14:29 <cjd> otherwise it would be flooding off all day  
14:29 <Denis> you mean that ircbot use multiple thread to write ,  
14:30 <Denis> ?  
14:30 <cjd> hopefully not :S  
14:30 <cjd> that would be an outrage  
14:30 <Denis> how could it be concurrent to itself then ?  
14:31 <cjd> in nodejs you'd use setTimeout() to schedule the sending of the next message

15:04 <vmassol> Enygma`: beware  
15:04 <vmassol> when you'll release your first version using maven and import it on e.x.o  
15:04 <vmassol> it'll remove that version  
15:04 <vmassol> (the 1.0)  
15:05 <vmassol> there's a jira for this, it needs to be fixed since it's a pain....

18:46 <Enygma`> vmassol: quick question, is it ok for the webjars action to check rights for the current user?  
18:46 <Enygma`> because it currently does  
18:47 <Enygma`> what rights does it actually check?  
18:47 <polx> has quit  
18:47 <Enygma`> a guest that does not have view rigths can not access js files from webjars  
18:47 <Enygma`> the view rights were removed with the checkbox in administration that denies all view rights for guests, regardless of page rights objects  
18:48 <vmassol> what line? I don't remember where that check would be?  
18:48 <vmassol> I don't see it in WebJarsResourceReferenceHandler  
18:48 <Enygma`> it seems to be the reason for http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/57/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui/RegisterTest/testRegisterInvalidEmail/  
18:48 <Enygma`> well, just set that rights option on a local instance and log out (use guest user) and check the console  
18:49 <Enygma`> downloadable font: download failed (font-family: "Glyphicons Halflings" style:normal weight:normal stretch:normal src index:1): status=2147746065  
18:49 <Enygma`> source: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/webjars/resources/path?value=bootstrap/3.2.0/fonts/glyphicons-halflings-regular.woff style.css  
18:49 <Enygma`> downloadable font: download failed (font-family: "Glyphicons Halflings" style:normal weight:normal stretch:normal src index:2): status=2147746065  
18:49 <vmassol> yes I know, ludovic reported the issue already  
18:49 <vmassol> but I haven't started investigating  
18:49 <vmassol> I thought you were doign that here :)  
18:49 <Enygma`> it`s in "the list" ?  
18:50 <vmassol> maybe it's done in XWikiAction before the call to the Reference handlers  
18:50 <Enygma`> ok, sorry gtg. Thanks so far. Will see more on Monday. Have a great weekend.  
18:50 <vmassol> indeed that's why  
18:50 <vmassol> just checked  
18:50 <vmassol> the problem is more global  
18:50 <vmassol> I'll comment on the issue  
18:51 <Enygma`> thx  
18:51 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11073

22:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
22:44 <sdumitriu1> vmassol: https://github.com/phenotips/phenotips/tree/issue-1116/components/storage-migrators  
22:45 <vmassol> Hi Sergiu  
22:45 <sdumitriu1> Hi Vincent  
22:46 <vmassol> automatic at startup?  
22:46 <sdumitriu1> At the moment yes  
22:46 <vmassol> cool, better than our script on e.x.o  
22:46 <sdumitriu1> I want to make it a step in the DistributionWizard  
22:46 <vmassol> yes having migrators part of the DW would be nice  
22:46 <sdumitriu1> It's generic, it can migrate anything to anything, as long as there's a reader and a writer  
22:47 <vmassol> using liquibase?  
22:47 <sdumitriu1> No, plain java  
22:47 <vmassol> so you rewrote liquibase :)  
22:47 <sdumitriu1> Well, AFAIK, liquibase deals with databases  
22:47 <sdumitriu1> RDBMs  
22:48 <vmassol> ah yes osrry  
22:48 <vmassol> my bad  
22:48 <vmassol> indeed this has nothing to do  
22:48 <sdumitriu1> This currently works with Hibernate and Filesystem  
22:48 <sdumitriu1> But we could add NoSQL in the future  
22:48 <sdumitriu1> Gotta go  
22:48 <vmassol> can your system be used for ex to run wiki scripts at startup?  
22:48 <sdumitriu1> The code is almost done, if you can glance over it and tell me what you think, that would be great  
22:49 <sdumitriu1> Bye  
22:49 <vmassol> for ex, apps sometimes need to migrate xobject formats  
22:49 <vmassol> ok bye  
22:49 <vmassol> I'll be with parents in law over the we  
22:49 <vmassol> not sure I'll have time before next week
